title: JAF nokia Flash tool
description:
1. Create a path Ã¢â‚¬Å“C:Program FilesNokiaPhoenixProductsRM-xxxÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ in your PC (replace xxx with your phoneÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s actual code, for example it will be RM-596 for Nokia N8 Ã¢â‚¬â€œ press *#0000# at phones standby screen to know yours). No need to create this path if you already have Phoenix installed in PC as Phoenix Service Software creates this path automatically (except the last folder). Download official firmware files for your phone via Navifirm and paste them in Ã¢â‚¬Å“RM-xxxÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ (the last folder in the above created path
 
2. Install J.A.F. in your PC (JAF is compatible with Windows only (XP, etc). Now copy and paste Ã¢â‚¬Å“jaf_nok4models.iniÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ file (given with JAF in the archive you downloaded) into C:Program FilesODEONJAF (Confirm overwrite to replace the original one). Connect the phone to PC via data cable and select Ã¢â‚¬Å“PC Suite ModeÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ (at phoneÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s interface). If it is the first time you have connected the phone with PC then let the phone drivers install completely.

3. After installation, donÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t open JAF via shortcuts that appear on desktop. Instead launch OGM_JAF_PKEY_Emulator (given in the downloaded archive) and click Ã¢â‚¬Å“GOÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ button, if it gives error then try launching it again. Wait for a while as the emulator verifies J.A.F. installation and finally JAF is launched with an error Ã¢â‚¬Å“BOX DRIVER NOT INSTALLEDÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½, click OK


4. At JAF interface select Ã¢â‚¬Å“BB5 TabÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½.



5. At BB5 tab select (tick) Ã¢â‚¬Å“Manual ModeÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½, Ã¢â‚¬Å“Dead USBÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ and uncheck Ã¢â‚¬Å“CRT 308Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½

6. Now check/tick Ã¢â‚¬Å“Use INIÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ option and wait for a while until Ã¢â‚¬Å“Select Phone Model box appears

7. Find and select your phone model from this box and click OK. The Ã¢â‚¬Å“MCUÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½, Ã¢â‚¬Å“PPMÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½, Ã¢â‚¬Å“CNTÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ and Ã¢â‚¬Å“APE VariantÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ boxes turn green

8. All set for flashing, now switch Off your connected phone and click Ã¢â‚¬Å“FLASHÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ button at JAF

9. A warning box will pop up, click Ã¢â‚¬Å“YESÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½. Now press phoneÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Power ON/OFF button for a second (DonÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t hold it for long). J.A.F. will start the flashing process. Wait for the process to complete (until Ã¢â‚¬Å“Done!Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½ appears in the JAF Ã¢â‚¬Å“Status and ResultsÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ window).

10. Disconnect phone from PC. Remove and re-insert phoneÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s battery and switch it on. Done!! Finally, that is your flashed phoneÃ¢â‚¬Â¦.whew!!!




NOTE Ã¢â‚¬â€œ 
1. Be careful not to touch mobile or data cable during flashing as sudden (even momentary) connection loss may irreversibly damage your phone. Also make sure that PC/Laptop/Netbook does not Ã¢â‚¬Å“Shut DownÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ suddenly (due to power interruption or battery low etc).
